alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 8:28PM MST until August 19 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * As of 825 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain fell leading to flash flooding. As a result, the stream gauge along Tonto Creek near Gun Creek indicates elevated flow. However, the gauge crested just below 6 feet and is now decreasing. Elevated flow will continue downstream of this gauge, producing potentially dangerous conditions. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila County and Tonto Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
